item.title: The pre-print for our new paper [https://arxiv
item.description: November 2025: The pre-print for our new paper SODBench: A Large Language Model Approach to Documenting Spreadsheet Operations (https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.19864) led by Amila Indika (https://www.linkedin.com/in/amila-indika/) is available online.

item.title: At 13:30 on 23 of October, HawAII is happy to host [https://baulab
item.description: October 2025: At 13:30 on 23 of October, HawAII is happy to host David Bau (https://baulab.info/) from Northeastern University in Boston who will deliver a talk on Mechanistic Interpretability of large neural networks. Please join us in Holmes Hall 411!

item.title: At 15:30 on Oct 8, I am giving a talk on Empirical Sequence Modeling at the [https://math
item.description: October 2025: At 15:30 on Oct 8, I am giving a talk on Empirical Sequence Modeling at the Applied Math Seminar (https://math.hawaii.edu/wordpress/applied-math-seminar/) of the Department of Mathematics at UH Manoa. slides are available (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1yrwY1PzXK-5fgqHYr6jb7T7HyCeONBT4r5rwYKCDogs/edit?usp=sharing)

item.title: The closed beta of our AI class companion (tutor, customizable by the instructor) is now hosted at [https://alu
item.description: September 2025: The closed beta of our AI class companion (tutor, customizable by the instructor) is now hosted at alu.institute (https://alu.institute/login). It is being served for the students enrolled in the pilot UH Manoa classes (ECE345, BUS619, ECON336) and whitelisted individuals. Please reach out if you want to try it in your class!

item.title: I am honored to deliver the keynote address on the state of AI at the SCV x SBI venture capital annual conference on Aug 13
item.description: August 2025: I am honored to deliver the keynote address on the state of AI at the SCV x SBI venture capital annual conference on Aug 13. The slides can be found here (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1bx_y3wEYCwdjWpHvvAczOlYEGeU7-IINrjfuAbfMp2g/edit?usp=sharing).

item.title: We are assembling a cross-institutional team to participate in the [https://virtualcellchallenge
item.description: July 2025: We are assembling a cross-institutional team to participate in the ARC Institute Virtual Cell Challenge (https://virtualcellchallenge.org/). This challenge focuses on predicting cellular responses to genetic or chemical perturbations using AI models. Please reach out if you are interested in participation or collaboration!

item.title: We are releasing a preprint of our paper on the pitfalls of vision-based video synchronization: [https://arxiv
item.description: June 2025: We are releasing a preprint of our paper on the pitfalls of vision-based video synchronization: "Beyond Audio and Pose: A General-Purpose Framework for Video Synchronization" (https://arxiv.org/abs/2506.15937).

item.title: Our paper [https://arxiv
item.description: June 2025 Our paper REAL: Response Embedding-based Alignment for LLMs (https://arxiv.org/abs/2409.17169) will be presented at IJCAI2025 workshop on Causal Learning for Recommendation Systems. (https://ijcai2025-workshop.github.io/causal-learning-recsys/)

item.title: We are releasing a [https://www
item.description: June 2025: We are releasing a public demo version of Roughcut (https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/dk7595qkkhmqhdvdmhk3v/Roughcut-0.0.2.dmg?rlkey=w55wqeuiyu499rjetbmrkd6fa&e=2&st=zzmy76ao&dl=0) - a video editing AI agent developed by Yosub Shin (https://www.linkedin.com/in/yosubshin/) in our lab. This MacOS app is focused on speech-heavy video and capable of conditional highlight extraction (https://www.loom.com/share/89ecb0c224f8485babb5bc05ae498c1c?sid=2b130377-e648-4803-8185-d887723cdc4d) and conversational editing via a chat interface (https://www.loom.com/share/85079491e45948c284621ed3572f782c?sid=3487789e-59f5-4483-91b5-1cb1d4a59542). We are actively sourcing feedback and encourage everyone to try it out!

item.title: Congratulations to [https://www
item.description: May 2025: Congratulations to Honggen Zhang (https://www.linkedin.com/in/honggen-zhang-2b42b0282) for passing his dissertation defense! He is going to join XtalPi (https://en.xtalpi.com/) and contribute to AI drug development.

item.title: A new permanent graduate-level course [https://igormolybog
item.description: April 2025: A new permanent graduate-level course ECE 605 (https://igormolybog.github.io/ece605_fall2025.html) on large-scale AI development and deployment will be taught in Fall 2025. It will include a series of paper-reading seminars where we will go over the most pressing technincal engineering challenges in the field and approaches to their solution.

item.title: [https://www
item.description: March 2025: Amila Indika (https://www.linkedin.com/in/amila-indika/), a talented Master's student under my co-supervision, is graduating this year and entering the job market!

item.title: I am visiting the [https://www
item.description: January 2025: I am visiting the Center for Language and Speech Processing (CLSP) (https://www.youtube.com/@jhuclsp/featured) at Johns Hopkins Computer Science with a brand new talk on scaling properties of LLM inference systems scheduled on February 21, 2025 (12:00-13:15).

item.title: We are delighted to kick off Spring 2025 HawAII AI paper reading seminar
item.description: December 2024: We are delighted to kick off Spring 2025 HawAII AI paper reading seminar. Please see flyer (https://drive.google.com/file/d/19B898gc8oO9z95XkpXdEs7_sg4SvACLI/view?usp=sharing) for the schedule and other details.

item.title: I presented the [https://arxiv
item.description: November 2024: I presented the REAL: Response Embedding-based Alignment for LLMs (https://arxiv.org/abs/2409.17169) at the UHM ICS seminar! The slides (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/13BkDbaKT22WtJeTQPXfthmFd1MTaREbJxp82m_BH2Vc/edit?usp=sharing) and recording (https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KwnQpB5IppVDV_1rKv9xpGwFwMRjmI6X/view?usp=sharing) are available.

item.title: [https://honggen-zhang
item.description: October 2024: Honggen Zhang (https://honggen-zhang.github.io/), an LLM expert working with my group is entering the job market this year!

item.title: We welcome [https://www
item.description: September 2024: We welcome Yosub Shin (https://www.linkedin.com/in/yosubshin/) as a full-time Graduate Researcher to our research group, working on advanced models for video processing and multimodal understanding.

item.title: We developed REAL - a simple algorithm for efficient high-quality preference data generation
item.description: September 2024: We developed REAL - a simple algorithm for efficient high-quality preference data generation. The preprint is available online: REAL: Response Embedding-based Alignment for LLMs (https://arxiv.org/abs/2409.17169).

item.title: I am participating in the [https://manoa
item.description: August 2024: I am participating in the AI Panel (https://manoa.hawaii.edu/ovprs/ai-in-higher-education-panel/) on October 11, 2024.

item.title: At noon on 1 Aug, I am giving a talk "Scaling generative modeling across model sizes and data modalities" at the lab meeting of [https://www
item.description: July 2024: At noon on 1 Aug, I am giving a talk "Scaling generative modeling across model sizes and data modalities" at the lab meeting of New York Genome Center (https://www.nygenome.org/).

item.title: At noon on 26 July, HawAII is happy to host [https://sites
item.description: July 2024: At noon on 26 July, HawAII is happy to host Nikita Zhivotovsky (https://sites.google.com/view/nikitazhivotovskiy/) from UC Berkeley who will deliver a talk on Improving Risk Bounds with Unbounded Losses via Data-Dependent Priors. Join us in POST 302!

item.title: Our paper on the economic trajectory of AI development [http://dx
item.description: June 2024: Our paper on the economic trajectory of AI development "What if synthetic data is all you need" (http://dx.doi.org/10.13140/RG.2.2.11362.75209) is available online!

item.title: A new [https://hawaii-ai
item.description: May 2024: A new HawAII reading group (https://hawaii-ai.github.io/ai-seminar/) just started! Please join us on Fridays 12:00-13:05 in POST 302 or reach out for a Zoom link.

item.title: Our paper [https://arxiv
item.description: April 2024: Our paper Effective Long-Context Scaling of Foundation Models (https://arxiv.org/pdf/2309.16039.pdf) will be presented at NAACL 2024 conference (https://2024.naacl.org/)!

item.title: We are thrilled to announce an upcoming collaboration with [https://epochai
item.description: March 2024: We are thrilled to announce an upcoming collaboration with Epoch AI (https://epochai.org/) on the technical and economical aspects of scaling Artificial Intelligence systems.

item.title: At 4 PM on 24 Apr, HawAII is happy to host [https://a2c2
item.description: March 2024: At 4 PM on 24 Apr, HawAII is happy to host Daniel Abramovitch (https://a2c2.org/contact/daniel-abramovitch) (Agilent Labs), Richard Braatz (https://a2c2.org/contact/richard-d-braatz) (MIT), and Kam Leang (https://www.mech.utah.edu/directory/faculty/kam-k-leang/) (U. Utah) in Webster Hall 203 with a talk on automatic control! zoom link (https://hawaii.zoom.us/j/91862139572); recording (https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zW5l9vWfwXvPXQnwkuZOP58VvyW6BbSo/view?usp=sharing); .

item.description: February 2024: Our paper HaSa: Hardness and Structure-Aware Contrastive Knowledge Graph Embedding (https://arxiv.org/abs/2305.10563) has been accepted at The Web Conference 2024 (https://www2024.thewebconf.org/)

item.description: January 2024: Our research group has been awarded compute resources by the ACCESS Allocations (https://allocations.access-ci.org/) program.

item.title: We are delighted to announce the [https://haw-aii
item.description: January 2024: We are delighted to announce the Hawai'i Artificial Intelligence Initiative (https://haw-aii.github.io) aiming to accelerate AI research at UHM by fostering collaboration
